HOP.NAME: Ahtanum
HOP.NOTES: Primarily used for its aromatic characteristics. Mild bitterness. Aromas of flower, citrus and lemon.

HOP.NAME: Amarillo
HOP.NOTES: Versatile hop, used for bittering and for aroma. Intense flower and citrus aromas.

HOP.NAME: Apollo
HOP.NOTES: Used for bittering. Insane alpha acid content. Notes of lime, grapefruit and pine.

HOP.NAME: Aramis
HOP.NOTES: Grassy, flowery and spicy notes, reminescent of the Strisselspalter.

HOP.NAME: Archer
HOP.NOTES: New english breed. Can be used for its classic english bitterness or for its delicate peach and citrus aromas.

HOP.NAME: Ariana
HOP.NOTES: New german hop. Fruity, mild aroma of berries and sweet fruits with a hint of resin.

HOP.NAME: Barbe Rouge
HOP.NOTES: French hop. Woody and minty aroma with notes of flowers and citrus.

HOP.NAME: Belma
HOP.NOTES: Versatile hop with aromas of pineapple, melon, grapefruit, orange and strawberry.

HOP.NAME: Bobek
HOP.NOTES: Also known as Styrian Bobek. Pleasant noble hop aromas of grass and pine, with hints of citrus.

HOP.NAME: Bramling Cross
HOP.NOTES: Rare english hop. Aromas of lemon, blackcurrant and pear.

HOP.NAME: Bravo
HOP.NOTES: Bittering hop with resinous notes of pine.

HOP.NAME: Brewers Gold
HOP.NOTES: English bittering hop with notes of spice and blackcurrant.

HOP.NAME: Calypso
HOP.NOTES: Despite its aroma-focused origins, it boasts a high alpha acid percentage. Aromas of pear, apple and peach.

HOP.NAME: Cascade (CH)
HOP.NOTES: Not as citrussy as its american counterpart. Still floral notes of grapefruit and citrus.

HOP.NAME: Cascade (USA)
HOP.NOTES: Classic american pale ale hop. Distinctive aromas of grapefruit and citrus.

HOP.NAME: Celeia
HOP.NOTES: Slovenian aroma hop with low alpha acids and notes of pine and lemon.

HOP.NAME: Centennial
HOP.NOTES: Classic american C-hop. Grassy and resinous notes of citrus.

HOP.NAME: Challenger
HOP.NOTES: Classic english hop with earthy notes of grass and pine.

HOP.NAME: Chinook
HOP.NOTES: Classic american C-hop. Good bittering characteristics and strong grapefruit flavour.

HOP.NAME: Citra
HOP.NOTES: Classic american C-hop. Good bittering characteristics and strong lime and grapefruit flavour but also hints of tropical fruits.

HOP.NAME: Cluster
HOP.NOTES: One of the oldest american hops. Clean, slightly floral aromas.

HOP.NAME: Columbus
HOP.NOTES: Very high alpha acid content. Aromas of resin, pepper, grapefruit and citrus.

HOP.NAME: Comet
HOP.NOTES: Wild american hop. Strong grapefruit and dank resin flavours.

HOP.NAME: Crystal
HOP.NOTES: American breed from Cascade, Hallertau, Brewers Gold and Early Green. Spicy and woody notes of cinnamon, pepper and muscat.

HOP.NAME: Delta
HOP.NOTES: American breed from Fuggles and Cascade. Features mild and pleasant english aromas crossed with citrus and apple.

HOP.NAME: Dr. Rudi
HOP.NOTES: Exotic hop with aromas of pine, lemongrass and grass.

HOP.NAME: Ekuanot
HOP.NOTES: High oil content. Intense aromas of tropical fruits.

HOP.NAME: El Dorado
HOP.NOTES: Versatile hop with all sorts of aromas straight ouf of a fruit basket: tropical fruits, peach, apricot, pear, watermelon and cherry.

HOP.NAME: Ella
HOP.NOTES: Australian hop with tropical flavours and grapefruit. Delicate notes of star anise.

HOP.NAME: Eureka
HOP.NOTES: Insane alpha acid contents. Flavours of citrus, peach and pine.

HOP.NAME: First Gold
HOP.NOTES: Versatile english hop with notes of tangerine, orange, cinnamon and mint.

HOP.NAME: Fuggles
HOP.NOTES: One of the classic english hops. Earthy aromas of grass and pine.

HOP.NAME: Galaxy
HOP.NOTES: High oil content. Citrus, peach and passionfruit aromas.

HOP.NAME: Glacier
HOP.NOTES: Versatile hop with not too much alpha acids. Notes of peach, apricot and citrus.

HOP.NAME: East Kent Goldings
HOP.NOTES: Sometimes called the King of english hops. Typical grassy english aromas.

HOP.NAME: Green Bullet
HOP.NOTES: High alpha acids yet smooth taste with notes of raisin and citrus.

HOP.NAME: Hallertau Blanc
HOP.NOTES: Complex flavour profile with notes of white-wine and fruit, elderflower, grapefruit and lemongrass

HOP.NAME: Hallertau Mittelfrüh
HOP.NOTES: Classic european noble hop. Mild bitter aromas for Lagers.

HOP.NAME: Hallertau Tradition
HOP.NOTES: Classic european noble hop. Earty and grassy aromas.

HOP.NAME: Herkules
HOP.NOTES: Strong german bittering hop. Notes of melon, pepper and pine.

HOP.NAME: Hersbrucker
HOP.NOTES: Classic european noble hop. Spicy, grassy aromas.

HOP.NAME: Horizon
HOP.NOTES: Versatile hop, yet primarily used for bittering. Floral and citrussy aromas.

HOP.NAME: Huell Melon
HOP.NOTES: New german aroma hop. Sweet flavours of cantaloupe and strawberry.

HOP.NAME: Kohatu
HOP.NOTES: Intense aroma of tropical fruit and freshly crushed pine needles, it adds a wonderfully fresh character to beer.

HOP.NAME: Lemondrop
HOP.NOTES: Sometimes called Super-Cascade. Intense aromas of grapefruit, blackberry, mint and grass.

HOP.NAME: Liberty
HOP.NOTES: Similar to Hallertau Mittelfrüh or other european noble hops. Mild, resinous aromas with hints of citrus.

HOP.NAME: Loral
HOP.NOTES: New american hop with aromas of flowers, peppers, citrus and dark fruits.

HOP.NAME: Magnum
HOP.NOTES: Clean bittering hop. Subtle citrus flavours.

HOP.NAME: Mandarina Bavaria
HOP.NOTES: Sweet and fruity tangerine aromas.

HOP.NAME: Millenium
HOP.NOTES: Strong bittering hop with hints of pineapple and resin.

HOP.NAME: Mosaic
HOP.NOTES: Versatile hop with complex but clean flavour characteristics. Notes of mango, pine, citrus and tropical fruits.

HOP.NAME: Mount Hood
HOP.NOTES: An american hop trying to imitate european noble hops. Grassy and spicy notes with a hint of grapefruit.

HOP.NAME: Nelson Sauvin
HOP.NOTES: Versatile hop mostly used for its white-wine like aromas. Notes of grapes, gooseberry and grapefruit.

HOP.NAME: Northdown
HOP.NOTES: British hop with classic english hop aromas. Earthy notes of pine and cedar.

HOP.NAME: Northern Brewer
HOP.NOTES: Dual-use hop with great smooth bitterness characteristics and typical minty and resinous aromas.

HOP.NAME: Nugget
HOP.NOTES: German dual-use hop with fruity and spicy aromas.

HOP.NAME: Opal
HOP.NOTES: Features a clean aroma and flavor profile of spice and citrus with a hint of sweetness.

HOP.NAME: Pacific Gem
HOP.NOTES: Despite its high alpha acids its high cohumulone content makes its use as a bittering hop problematic. It can, and is, used as an early addition but is more well known for its aroma of oak and blackberry.

HOP.NAME: Pacific Jade
HOP.NOTES: Smooth, soft bitterness and interesting flavour profile of citrus and cracked pepper.

HOP.NAME: Pacifica
HOP.NOTES: Low alpha acid hop from New Zealand. Citrusy, spicy, orange and floral aromas.

HOP.NAME: Perle
HOP.NOTES: German dual-use hop and good substitute for Hallertau Mitelfrüh. Notes of mint and pine.

HOP.NAME: Pilgrim
HOP.NOTES: Versatile english hop. Spicy notes of cedar and honey.

HOP.NAME: Polaris
HOP.NOTES: Hop with insane amounts of alpha acid, yet also interesting flavour profile with notes of mint and menthol.

HOP.NAME: Saaz
HOP.NOTES: Classic european noble hop. Hoppy, grassy flavours.

HOP.NAME: Saphir
HOP.NOTES: European noble hop with fruity and floral notes of citrus.

HOP.NAME: Sorachi Ace
HOP.NOTES: Japanese hop now cultivated in the US. Strong citrus notes with hints of coconut and pepper.

HOP.NAME: Simcoe
HOP.NOTES: This dual purpose hop has funky pine character, making it synonymous with American IPA.

HOP.NAME: Sterling
HOP.NOTES: Spicy, grassy aromas with hints of flowers and citrus.

HOP.NAME: Styrian Goldings
HOP.NOTES: Classic noble hop, mostly used in belgian ales.

HOP.NAME: Summit
HOP.NOTES: High-alpha american hop with classic american aromas of orange, tangerine and grapefruit.

HOP.NAME: Target
HOP.NOTES: English bittering hop with good bittering characteristics.

HOP.NAME: Tettnanger
HOP.NOTES: Classic european noble hop. Hoppy, grassy flavours.

HOP.NAME: Vic Secret
HOP.NOTES: New Australian hop. Intense aromas of pineapple, passionfruit and pine.

HOP.NAME: Wai-iti
HOP.NOTES: New Zealand hop. Aromas of freshly squeezed limes, citrus, apricots and peaches.

HOP.NAME: Willamette
HOP.NOTES: Americas answer to classic english hops. Spicy and flowery aromas.
